translated: As It Was Said🔽The Collection of Twos🔽The Second Section
Devoid of Wisdom

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One:

original: “Te, bhikkhave, sattā suparihīnā ye ariyāya paññāya parihīnā.🔽Te diṭṭheva dhamme dukkhaṁ viharanti savighātaṁ saupāyāsaṁ sapariḷāhaṁ;
analyzed: te bhikkhave sattā su parihīnā ye ariyāya paññāya parihīnā  te diṭṭhā iva dhamme dukkham viharanti sa vighātam sa upāyāsam sa pariḷāha
translated: “Those beings are greatly deprived who are deprived of noble wisdom.🔽In this very life they dwell in suffering, in despair, in dejection, and in fever,

original: kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā.
analyzed: kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā
translated: and with the breakup of the body, after death, a bad destination can be expected for them.

original: Te, bhikkhave, sattā aparihīnā ye ariyāya paññāya aparihīnā.
analyzed: te bhikkhave sattāḥ a parihīnāḥ ye ariyāya paññāya a parihīnā
translated: Those beings are not deprived who are not deprived of noble wisdom.

original: Te diṭṭheva dhamme sukhaṁ viharanti avighātaṁ anupāyāsaṁ apariḷāhaṁ;
analyzed: te diṭṭhā iva dhamme sukham viharanti avighātam an upāyāsam a pariḷāha
translated: In this very life they dwell in pleasure, without despair, dejection, or fever,

original: kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugati pāṭikaṅkhā”ti.
analyzed: kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugati pāṭikaṅkhāti
translated: and with the breakup of the body, after death, a good destination can be expected for them.”
The Blessed One said this.
And in connection with this, it was said:
“See the world with its gods,
Clinging to name-and-form,
Thinking: ‘This is true.’
Wisdom is supreme in the world,
That which leads to penetration.
By which one rightly understands
The destruction of birth and existence.

analyzed: tesam devāḥ manussā ca  sambuddhānam satīmata
translated: Gods and humans alike🔽long for the bodies of those who are fully awakened,
mindful, wise, and laughing,

original: sarīrantimadhārinan”ti.🔽Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: sarīrantimadhārinanti  ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: who are bearing their last bodies.”
This is the meaning of what the Buddha said. Thus have I heard:
